Detailed Description

An application container is an ApoxiThread and maps to one operating system thread.
An application container holds a variable number of applications. These applications are managed by an internal and resource-friendly APOXI scheduler, which assigns the threads processing time to the applications in a cooperative way.

When receiving a message, the application container determines all the applications which are registered for this message. Sequentially, each application is called to handle this message. During an application is handling a message, this application is considered as the active application.

Attaches an application to the application container.

BOOLEAN AppContainer::ContainsUserInputMsg (   )  const
 

Returns TRUE, if the message queue contains a user input message like e. g. a key-down message. This may be useful for blocking operations, which might be quited when a user input message is in the message queue.

void AppContainer::Detach (  Application *  app  )
